item.title: SSH PKI on top of Web PKI
item.description: Reading Future Internet PKI schemes need to be bootstrapped through web PKI I was reminded by all the problems I’ve had with SSH (Secure SHell) PKI (Public Key Infrastructure). SSH host verification is trust-on-first-use (TOFU). So SSH is protected from man-in-the-middle (MITM) attacks unless the first connection falls prey to the attack.

item.title: Why Open Source ERP Systems are the Better Choice for Your Business
item.description: As businesses grow, they require more complex systems to manage their operations. One such system that has become ubiquitous in recent years is the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system. An ERP system is a software suite that integrates and manages all aspects of a business’s operations, including finance, inventory, sales, and HR.

item.title: Is a square a rectangle? Liskov substitution principle in action
item.description: I will put that simple question in the room: "Is a square a rectangle?" And you might thank: "Well dah, of course!" But wait for a second and let's check it together. We will use the L in SOLID: The Liskov Substitution principle to check if this relationship makes sense for us!

item.title: The World's Smallest Hash Table
item.description: This December I once again did the Advent of Code, in Rust. If you are interested, my solutions are on Github. I wanted to highlight one particular solution to the day 2 problem as it is both optimized completely beyond the point of reason yet contains a useful technique. For simplicity we’re only going to do part 1 of the day 2 problem here, but the exact same techniques apply to part 2.

item.title: Daily Driving a Smartphone Without Screen
item.description: Last year my phone’s screen broke in a way, that made it register inputs even if nothing was touching it. Any reasonable person would simply get a new phone, but I am not reasonable and also didn’t have any spare cash back then. So here is a short post about how I used my phone without a screen for around a month.

item.title: ActivityPub: This ain't it, Chief - Junaid Bhura
item.description: Elon Musk’s purchase of Twitter makes no difference to me, but I’m extremely stoked about its unintended side-effect: People considering alternate platforms, and better yet, their own websites to share their thoughts. The W3C’s official protocol for “federated” social media is called ActivityPub. With the W3C’s blessing, it is now an official web protocol, which […]
